subsc: Central government administration,Crops,Other domestic and international trade,General industry and trade sector,Banking
trustfund:
TF026315-5TH DIMENSION OPERATION FOR ETHIOPIA,TF026295-ETHIOPIA 5TH DIMENSION SPA II,TF024655-1ST STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT
            CREDIT (SAC 1),TF024665-FIRST STRUCTURAL ADJ. CREDIT
            (SAC I)

abstracts.cdata!:
The Structural Adjustment Credit I (SAC
            I) supports the first phase of the economic policy of the
            Transitional Government of Ethiopia (TGE). The TGE's
            economic objective is to reduce poverty through rapid
            labor-intensive growth. This is to be achieved through a
            fundamental transformation of the economy from centralized
            planning to markets, with a dominant role for the private
            sector. In the period immediately following its assumption
            of power, the TGE concentrated on rehabilitation and relief
            to cope with the problems of civil disruption, extreme
            poverty and physical devastation caused by prolonged
            internal conflict. Since late-1992, when agreement on a
            Policy Framework Paper (PFP) was reached, the focus has
            shifted to reconstruction and structural reform. In the
            first phase, the program will consist of two main
            components: support for economic stabilization, and support
            for the private sector. For this, the following actions are
            covered by SAC I: adjustments in key economic prices
            (exchange rate, finance and wages); improvements in domestic
            resource mobilization, including a reduction in the fiscal
            imbalance; changes in the boundary between public and
            private economic activity; promotion of price signals and
            competition; introduction of a market-based system for
            allocating foreign exchange; trade reforms; and safety net
            policies for those affected by structural adjustment. During
            SAC I implementation period, the TGE will also build
            institutional capacities.
